findings.title: Deterministic Pseudo-Random Number
findings.description: The SpaceRace contract is using a very simple technique that combines only the block.difficulty and block.timestamp, which can be easily manipulated by users under specific circumstances.

findings.title: Contract Balance Dependency
findings.description: The calculation of sell and buy prices heavily depends on the SapceRace contract's amount, which can be abused by users and produce unexpected results in the financial ecosystem.

findings.title: Initial Amount Distribution
findings.description: The price calculations depend on the initial contractâ€™s funds, which can lead to underflow if the contract's amount is insufficient.

findings.title: Public Function could be Declared External
findings.description: Public functions that are never called by the contract should be declared external to save gas.

findings.title: State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: Constant state variables should be declared constant to save gas.

findings.title: Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The contract does not follow the Solidity naming convention.

findings.title: Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: There are functions that have no event emitted, making it difficult to track off-chain changes.

findings.title: Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.
